name: ext_R5_InventoryItem
title: Cross-version Extension for R5.InventoryItem for use in FHIR R2
description: This cross-version extension represents InventoryItem from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/InventoryItem|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R2.

element.short: A functional description of an inventory item used in inventory and supply-related workflows
element.definition: Optional Extensions Element - found in all resources.

element.short: Net content or amount present in the item
element.definition: The comparator is not used on a SimpleQuantity
element.comment: The context of use may frequently define what kind of quantity this is and therefore what kind of units can be used. The context of use may also restrict the values for the comparator.

constraint.human: If a code for the unit is present, the system SHALL also be present
The comparator is not used on a SimpleQuantity

mapping.map: PQ, IVL<PQ>, MO, CO, depending on the values

element.short: The related item or product

element.short: The quantity of the product in this product
element.definition: The quantity of the related product in this product - Numerator is the quantity of the related product. Denominator is the quantity of the present product. For example a value of 20 means that this product contains 20 units of the related product; a value of 1:20 means the inverse - that the contained product contains 20 units of the present product.

element.short: The related item or product
The related item or product
The quantity of the product in this product
element.definition: The quantity of the related product in this product - Numerator is the quantity of the related product. Denominator is the quantity of the present product. For example a value of 20 means that this product contains 20 units of the related product; a value of 1:20 means the inverse - that the contained product contains 20 units of the present product.

element.short: The quantity of the product in this product
element.definition: The quantity of the related product in this product - Numerator is the quantity of the related product. Denominator is the quantity of the present product. For example a value of 20 means that this product contains 20 units of the related product; a value of 1:20 means the inverse - that the contained product contains 20 units of the present product.

element.short: < | <= | >= | > | ad - how to understand the value
element.definition: How the value should be understood and represented - whether the actual value is greater or less than the stated value due to measurement issues; e.g. if the comparator is "<" , then the real value is < stated value.
element.isModifierReason: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because the comparator modifies the interpretation of the value significantly. If there is no comparator, then there is no modification of the value
